items.sentence: I wonder whether or not I should talk to Tom about that.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already thought of that.
I wondered whether or not Tom thought he had to do that.
I wondered whether or not Tom thought we had to do that.
I wondered whether or not Tom thought we should do that.
I know you\'re busy, but can I talk to you for a minute?
I know you\'ve got more important things to think about.
How many times a week do you help Tom with his homework?
I feel like everyone is talking about me behind my back.
Tom couldn\'t eat anything, but he drank a little water.
Tom didn\'t want to make the same mistake that Mary did.
I want to hear the whole story. Don\'t skip any details.
Tom wants this back as soon as you\'re finished with it.
When Tom got to Mary\'s house, she was already sleeping.
Tell us more about what you did when you were in Boston.
We\'ve decided to postpone the meeting till next Monday.
What does Tom get in return for all the work he\'s done?
I think we should try doing the same thing Tom is doing.
I was going to tell you that yesterday, but I forgot to.
I was surprised when Tom told me Mary wanted to do that.
I went into the kitchen to make myself something to eat.
I don\'t know why Tom wanted to go to Boston by himself.
I don\'t speak French well enough to apply for that job.
I don\'t think Tom and Mary will ever get back together.
Tom was the one who broke the windshield of Mary\'s car.
Tom advised Mary not to borrow too much money from John.
I want to live in the same neighborhood where Tom lives.
Tom asked Mary what she had bought at the jewelry store.
Tom attempted to persuade Mary to go to church with him.
Tom believes that the death penalty should be abolished.
Tom certainly gets a nice sound out of that old bassoon.
I wish I could get Tom to help pull weeds in the garden.
I gave Tom the same advice that I\'d already given Mary.
I wish I\'d been able to visit you when I was in Boston.
Were you able to convince Tom to help you wash your car?
What kind of stuff do you keep in the trunk of your car?
If he really doesn\'t want to go, he shouldn\'t have to.
If this problem weren\'t serious, Tom wouldn\'t be here.
Are you saying that Tom can\'t understand French at all?
I wish you wouldn\'t say those kinds of things about me.
I wonder if there\'s a chance Tom will be here tomorrow.
People tell you a lot of things that aren\'t quite true.
Tom and Mary gave their mother flowers on Mother\'s Day.
You\'ve given three copies of the report to Tom already.
Tom said he wanted to live in a French-speaking country.
Tom didn\'t know who Mary was planning to see in Boston.
The party we\'ve been invited to is tomorrow, not today.
I heard Tom\'s car drive up, but he hasn\'t come in yet.
Tom isn\'t used to driving on the left side of the road.
Why didn\'t you tell me you didn\'t know how to do this?
Why don\'t you wait here while I finish what I\'m doing?
If this story doesn\'t interest you, go on to Chapter 2.
Tom won\'t be able to finish the job unless we help him.
Tom\'s heart stopped, but doctors managed to revive him.
I just don\'t know why Tom doesn\'t want me to help him.
Tom likes you too, Mary. He\'s just too shy to admit it.
Washing dishes is something I don\'t really enjoy doing.
We can\'t afford to spend any more time waiting for Tom.
Didn\'t you know Tom lived in Australia for a long time?
Tom was the one who thought that we should take a break.
We don\'t yet know how many people died in the accident.
Tom assured us that he\'ll have that done before Monday.
Tom tried to do that by himself, but he wasn\'t able to.
We shouldn\'t have tried doing that without Tom\'s help.
Tom took a book out of his knapsack and started reading.
Tom tried to sneak out of the office without being seen.
I thought Tom would end up going to the party with Mary.
I think I might be able to speak French better than Tom.
I want to know what happened to the pistol Tom gave you.
I\'ve had a crush on you since the first time I met you.
I\'ve learned a lot of French by watching French movies.
I\'ve never experienced anything quite like this before.
I\'ve noticed some strange things happening around here.
Tom and Mary ate lunch on a terrace overlooking the sea.
Tom and Mary had nothing in the world except each other.
Tom\'s family showed a video of his life at his funeral.
I can\'t survive without air conditioning in the summer.
Tom was the one who taught me how to sing country music.
Tom was very sleepy and could hardly keep his eyes open.
Tom was wearing a jacket, even though it was pretty hot.
Tom assured Mary that everything had been taken care of.
Tom has been trying to get Mary out of prison for years.
Tom asked Mary if she knew John\'s new telephone number.
Tom couldn\'t figure out how Mary managed to stay alive.
Tom doesn\'t know how Mary was able to afford a new car.
Tom doesn\'t know the difference between linen and wool.
I know something is wrong, but I\'m not quite sure what.
Tom booked a room for me at a hotel near where he lived.
Tom took his key out of his pocket and unlocked the car.
I\'m supposed to meet Tom in Boston next Monday at 2:30.
Tom intends to play tennis tomorrow afternoon with Mary.
Tom introduced himself to the people behind the counter.
Tom is in the hospital, recovering from a drug overdose.
Tom didn\'t have enough money to buy what he had to buy.
Tom didn\'t have the decency to admit that he was wrong.
Tom didn\'t know for certain what time he should arrive.
Had it not been for your help, I couldn\'t have done it.
Tom has a daughter that goes to the same school as Mary.
Tom has already decided where he wants to go to college.
Tom has already gotten three threatening phone messages.
